decision_conditions: <p>Prior to the commencement of the relevant part of works, details of the following shall be submit to and approved in writing by the LPA:</p><p>a) proposed method of brick repair, </p><p>b) proposed mortar mix,&nbsp;</p><p>c) repointing method, </p><p>d) method of the render/stucco repairs</p><p>The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the approved details.</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the special interest of the listed building.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Notwithstanding the approved drawings and documents, no consent is given for the application of any Prokol liquid waterproofing system to the balconies or entrance steps.&nbsp;<br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building</p>

<p>No permission is granted for any new plumbing, pipes, soil stacks, flues, vents, ductwork, grilles, security alarms, lighting, cameras or other appurtenances fixed to any external faces of the building unless shown on the drawings hereby approved. All new external rainwater goods and soil pipes shall be of cast iron, painted black.<br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building</p>

<p>The new roofing covering shall precisely match the existing roofing materials adjacent in respect of unit dimensions; colour and texture; unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.<br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building</p><p><br></p>

<p>All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.<br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building</p>

<p>No cleaning of masonry, other than low pressure (20-100 psi) surface cleaning using a nebulous water spray is authorised by this consent without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; The works shall be carried out in accordance with the method approved by the Local Planning Authority.&nbsp; Before work begins, any other cleaning proposals must be approved in writing and carried out strictly in accordance with those details.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.<br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building</p>

The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
description: Repairs works and alterations to nine Grade II Listed Buildings at 207-223 Stoke Newington Church Street; including replacement roof slates, mansard slates, gutter detailing, hoppers, replacement of timber windows, and installation of secondary glazing.
